newsitem.title: ESTONIA: Estonian Savings Bank okays Bank of Industry deal.
newsitem.headline: Estonian Savings Bank okays Bank of Industry deal.

text.p: Shareholders of one the largest commercial banks in the Baltic state of Estonia on Friday backed a merger with the country's eighth largest bank and an issue of shares to boost its capital, a Savings Bank spokesman said.
The bank aims to merge with the Bank of Industry and the spokesman said a special shareholders meeting gave overwhelming backing for the move.
The merger was hit by controversy after leading politicians alleged the Bank of Industry had large, hidden loan losses, although the bank said the losses were lower.
The merger will boost Savings Bank's assets to more than four billion kroons ($335.4 million).
Savings Bank made a profit of 22.4 million kroons in the first half of the year.
The share capital rise will be worth 10 million kroons and will take the capital up to 143 million kroons. It will consist of one million shares with a face value of 10 kroons.
